Trump and the 'derangement syndrome' driving people crazy
subhead: To discredit the president's opponents, the Make America Great Again movement has coined the phrase 'Trump derangement syndrome': a supposed mental illness that explains their systematic opposition. While the psychiatric argument for this has not been proven, many Democrats attest to the anger they feel every time the president speaks.

French PM ups pressure on government to avoid budget deadlock
As France tries to contain cattle lumpy skin disease, PM seeks Christmas truce with agricultural unions
subhead: The prime minister met Friday with leaders of France's main farming unions but did not announce any real change in managing an outbreak of lumpy skin disease, or contagious nodular dermatitis.

title: In Ukraine, Russian forces increasingly target the railway network
subhead: Since the start of the year, the national rail company Ukrzaliznytsia has recorded more than 1,000 attacks. While most have been concentrated on stations near the Russian border and front line, the rest of the country has not been spared.

title: 'Emily in Paris,' season 5, on Netflix: Her weekend in Rome
subhead: The production moved a few episodes to Italy, where, once again, it is the character Sylvie, played by Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu, who delivers the best moments.

title: Lafarge terrorism financing trial: Defense urges court to acknowledge 'complexity' of case
subhead: The trial of the cement manufacturer on charges of terrorism financing concluded Friday, following three intense days devoted to the defense lawyers' arguments. The verdict is expected on April 13, 2026.

A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhead: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

title: 'The New Yorker at 100': A certain idea of journalism, narrated by Julianne Moore
subhead: Marshall Curry's documentary takes viewers behind the scenes of the iconic American weekly magazine, which continues to thrive in the modern era.

title: 'Academic freedom at risk': The Danish university shaken by an anti-immigration cabal
subhead: Roskilde University found itself at the center of controversy over its programs, which were accused by both the far right and Social Democratic Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen of being a backdoor route to immigration for foreign students.
